name: Siargao
description: Known as the "Surfing Capital of the Philippines," Siargao is a teardrop-shaped island with perfect waves, lush mangroves, and a laid-back atmosphere.
longDescription:
Siargao is a teardrop-shaped island in the Philippine Sea that has gained international recognition as the "Surfing Capital of the Philippines." The island is most famous for Cloud 9, a powerful right-breaking reef wave that has consistently ranked among the top surf spots in the world. Every September, Siargao hosts the international surfing competition, attracting professional surfers from around the globe.

Beyond surfing, Siargao offers a diverse range of natural attractions. The island is home to extensive mangrove forests, particularly in Del Carmen, which can be explored by boat or kayak. The Magpupungko Rock Pools, natural tidal pools that appear during low tide, offer a unique swimming experience. Island hopping to the nearby Naked, Daku, and Guyam islands reveals pristine beaches and excellent snorkeling opportunities.

Despite its growing popularity, Siargao maintains a laid-back, bohemian atmosphere. The main town of General Luna has developed a vibrant scene with surf shops, yoga studios, and an eclectic mix of restaurants and bars. The island's commitment to sustainability is evident in its numerous eco-friendly accommodations and initiatives to protect its natural resources. Whether you're a surfer, nature lover, or someone seeking a relaxed tropical getaway, Siargao offers an authentic Philippine island experience.
howToGetThere: To reach Siargao, fly to Sayak Airport (also known as Siargao Airport) from Manila or Cebu. Several airlines operate daily flights to the island. From the airport, take a van or tricycle to General Luna or other parts of the island, which is about a 45-minute drive. Alternatively, you can take a ferry from Surigao City on the mainland, which takes approximately 2-3 hours depending on sea conditions.
